alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 1:31AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties near Sedona through 200 AM MST... At 131 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sedona, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Junipine Resort, Village At Oak Creek, Garland`s Oak Creek Lodge, Slide Rock State Park, Red Rock State Park and Manzanita Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 179 between mile markers 306 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 366 and 376, and between mile markers 379 and 383. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
